intro: Daucus gingidium var. africanus, commonly known as the African cowparley, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been traditionally used in herbal remedies by local communities.
